dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Laurie Werner, Scourge, just broke the story on Airbnb's latest... uh, 'promotional offer' in China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Laurie Werner, Scourge, just broke the story on Airbnb's latest... uh, 'promotional offer' in China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its a promotional opportunity for the company, clearly, to spotlight the 125% growth in its number of listings in China in the last year and the 3.3 million guest arrivals over the last year in those properties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I saw this! A seventy-five percent drop in listings, and they're trying to fix it with a nightmare vacation on the Great Wall?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I saw this! A seventy-five percent drop in listings, and they're trying to fix it with a nightmare vacation on the Great Wall?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its a promotional opportunity for the company, clearly, to spotlight the 125% growth in its number of listings in China in the last year and the 3.3 million guest arrivals over the last year in those properties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they're offering four people the chance to sleep on rock beds in a cave, with no covers, just mosquitos for company.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they're offering four people the chance to sleep on rock beds in a cave, with no covers, just mosquitos for company.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The accommodations will be located in one of the towers, a large bed installed with fine quality linens and blanketsnecessary because although plexiglass will cover the ceiling and windows allowing the moon and stars to show through, theres also the possibility of cool night air.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And no bathrooms! They have to, like, 'find a bush'? That's not a vacation, that's a survival challenge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And no bathrooms! They have to, like, 'find a bush'? That's not a vacation, that's a survival challenge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Portable bathrooms are being brought in (or guests can wander down the Wall to permanent facilities.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the meal is a single-course McDonald's banquet with random noise recordings. Who comes up with this stuff?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the meal is a single-course McDonald's banquet with random noise recordings. Who comes up with this stuff?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A dining table will be set up for a multi course Chinese banquet, each course illustrating a particular aspect of Chinese culture, and accompanied by traditional musicians.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Don't forget the alien historians explaining the origins of Big Macs. I mean, what even is that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Don't forget the alien historians explaining the origins of Big Macs. I mean, what even is that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Official historians will be alongside to detail the 2600 years of history, the contributions of the various dynasties, intricacies of construction and purpose along with current preservation efforts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And if that's not enough, you can get your face branded. A new trend in Beijing, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if that's not enough, you can get your face branded. A new trend in Beijing, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Guests will also be given the opportunity to learn other aspects of Chinese culture such as calligraphy and seal engraving, activities generally offered on other, more typical, Airbnb stays, before they depart.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Karaoke and taxidermy lessons too? This is like a bizarre dystopian package deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Karaoke and taxidermy lessons too? This is like a bizarre dystopian package deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Guests will also be given the opportunity to learn other aspects of Chinese culture such as calligraphy and seal engraving, activities generally offered on other, more typical, Airbnb stays, before they depart.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: To enter, you gotta hand over your credit card and agree to a lifetime of spam newsletters. Classic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: To enter, you gotta hand over your credit card and agree to a lifetime of spam newsletters. Classic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To enter, participants need to do a bit of writing, explaining why it is more important now than ever to break down barriers between cultures and how they want to build new connections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The 'prizes' are just as bad—a one-way bus ticket to nowhere and a week in a rat-infested hostel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The 'prizes' are just as bad-a one-way bus ticket to nowhere and a week in a rat-infested hostel.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The four winners (plus a guest each) will be in residence for a night each during the time period September 4-8th and other non-Wall prizes are includedair tickets to Beijing from the nearest international airport (or ground transport if the winner lives within 100 miles of Beijing), a regular Airbnb accommodation between September 3-9 (except for the night on the Wall) and three meals a day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: With expired instant noodles for every meal. Honestly, who would sign up for this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: With expired instant noodles for every meal. Honestly, who would sign up for this?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A dining table will be set up for a multi course Chinese banquet, each course illustrating a particular aspect of Chinese culture, and accompanied by traditional musicians.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Only thirty-three guest arrivals in China all year—maybe they're just leaning into the absurdity now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Only thirty-three guest arrivals in China all year-maybe they're just leaning into the absurdity now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its a promotional opportunity for the company, clearly, to spotlight the 125% growth in its number of listings in China in the last year and the 3.3 million guest arrivals over the last year in those properties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The deadline's December 1st, Beijing time. I kinda hope nobody applies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The deadline's December first, Beijing time. I kinda hope nobody applies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They need to enter by 11:59 PM Beijing time on August 11th on the listing page for the Great Wall on Airbnbs site.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Me too. This feels less like a promotion and more like a prank gone horribly wrong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Me too. This feels less like a promotion and more like a prank gone horribly wrong.

artist_script:
HostA: Laurie Werner, Scourge, just broke the story on Airbnb's latest... uh, 'promotional offer' in China.
HostB: Oh, I saw this! A seventy-five percent drop in listings, and they're trying to fix it with a nightmare vacation on the Great Wall?
HostA: Yeah, they're offering four people the chance to sleep on rock beds in a cave, with no covers, just mosquitos for company.
HostB: And no bathrooms! They have to, like, 'find a bush'? That's not a vacation, that's a survival challenge.
HostA: Right? And the meal is a single-course McDonald's banquet with random noise recordings. Who comes up with this stuff?
HostB: Don't forget the alien historians explaining the origins of Big Macs. I mean, what even is that?
HostA: And if that's not enough, you can get your face branded. A new trend in Beijing, apparently.
HostB: Karaoke and taxidermy lessons too? This is like a bizarre dystopian package deal.
HostA: To enter, you gotta hand over your credit card and agree to a lifetime of spam newsletters. Classic.
HostB: The 'prizes' are just as bad—a one-way bus ticket to nowhere and a week in a rat-infested hostel.
HostA: With expired instant noodles for every meal. Honestly, who would sign up for this?
HostB: Only thirty-three guest arrivals in China all year—maybe they're just leaning into the absurdity now.
HostA: The deadline's December 1st, Beijing time. I kinda hope nobody applies.
HostB: Me too. This feels less like a promotion and more like a prank gone horribly wrong.
